'''Cuiviénen''' was a land on the shores of the inland [[Sea of Helcar]] in the far east of [[Middle-earth]] where the first [[Elves]] [[Awakening of the Elves|awoke]].<ref name=":0">{{S|Captivity}}</ref>

==History==
[[Ilúvatar]] [[Awakening of the Elves|awoke]] the first [[Elves]], the ''[[Quendi]]'' as they came to call themselves, by Cuiviénen in [[Year of the Trees 1050|1050th]] [[Years of the Trees|Year of the Trees]],<ref>{{MR|P2a}}, entry 1050, §§ 36-9, pp. 71-2</ref><ref>{{WJ|One}}, entry "VY 1050", §3, p. 5</ref> and thus the [[First Age]] at last began.<ref name="Annals">{{MR|P2a}}, §10, p. 51</ref><ref>{{NM|P1xvii}}, p. 123</ref> From the first they were divided into three groups: the [[Minyar]], [[Tatyar]], and [[Nelyar]]. They dwelt in Cuiviénen for more than fifty [[Valian Years]] before the first [[Sundering of the Elves|sundering]].  Many of the Elves, particularly of the Minyar and Tatyar, journeyed west to [[Valinor]] and, if they did not tarry in Middle-earth, saw its light and became known as the [[Eldar]]. Those who remained were called the [[Avari]], the unwilling, for they did not desire to see the beauty of that land, but preferred the starlight of Cuiviénen. After the [[War of Wrath]] and the [[Changing of the World]], Cuiviénen was destroyed and could no longer be sought out by the Eldar.<ref name=":0" />

==Geography==
Cuiviénen lay on the shores of a bay on the inland [[Sea of Helcar]]'s eastern end, at the foot of [[Orocarni]] near the [[Wild Wood]]. Located in the central regions of Middle-earth, Cuiviénen was far to the west of where the first Men later awoke in [[Hildórien]].<ref>{{NM|P1vi}}, p. 38</ref> It was approximately 2,000 miles east of [[Beleriand]]'s shoreline with [[Belegaer]] at [[Eglarest]], as the crow flies, and it was about a 450 mile march east or southeast of the inland [[Sea of Rhûn]].<ref>{{NM|P1vii}}, pp. 47, 49</ref> On the east side of the lake near which the Elves woke was a great cliff from which a waterfall came down. Near the lake was a green valley, a second larger valley, a third deeper and wider valley, a grove of birches by a stream and a firwood on a hill-side.<ref>{{WJ|Appendix}}, pp. 422-3</ref>

==Etymology==
{{Pronounce|Cuivienen.mp3|Ardamir}}
The [[Quenya]] name ''Cuiviénen'' means "Water of Awakening",<ref>{{S|Index}}, entry "Cuiviénen"</ref> from ''[[cuivië]]'' ("awakening") + ''[[nen]]'' ("water").<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, entries ''[[cuivië]]'', ''[[nen]]''</ref>

The [[Noldorin]]/[[Sindarin]] cognate was '''''Nen Echui'''''.<ref>{{LR|A2}}, p. 406</ref><ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "KUY-"</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', the "Waters of Awakening" were named '''''Koivië-Néni''''' in [[Qenya]], and '''''Nenin a Gwivros''''' in [[Gnomish]].<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entry "Koivië-néni"</ref>
